qas.question: When did the Islamic Golden age start?
What other age occurred at the same time as the Islamic Golden Age?
There what is the latest year for the end of the Islamic Golden Age?
What years did Abbasid caliph Harun ar-Rashid reign?
Where was the House of Wisdom held?
What State was first established in the 6th century?
What golden age occurred at the same time as the Middle Ages?
What did the Mongolians sack in the 12th century?

plausible_answers.text: the Emirate of Granada in Al-Andalus, Iberian Peninsula

qas.question: What did the Christians reconquer in 1492?
What caliph reigned in the 7th and 8th century?

context: <b6_0>The Islamic Golden Age<b6_0/> coincided with <a1_0>the Middle Ages<a1_0/> in the Muslim world, starting with the rise of Islam and establishment of the <b5_0>first Islamic state<b5_0/> in <a0_0>622<a0_0/>. The end of the age is variously given as 1258 with the Mongolian Sack of <b7_0>Baghdad<b7_0/>, or <a2_0>1492<a2_0/> with the completion of the Christian Reconquista of <b8_0>the Emirate of Granada in Al-Andalus, Iberian Peninsula<b8_0/>. During the reign of the Abbasid caliph <b9_0>Harun ar-Rashid<b9_0/> (<a3_0>786 to 809<a3_0/>), the legendary House of Wisdom was inaugurated in <a4_0>Baghdad<a4_0/> where scholars from various parts of the world sought to translate and gather all the known world's knowledge into Arabic. The Abbasids were influenced by the Quranic injunctions and hadiths, such as "the ink of a scholar is more holy than the blood of a martyr," that stressed the value of knowledge. The major Islamic capital cities of Baghdad, Cairo, and Córdoba became the main intellectual centers for science, philosophy, medicine, and education. During this period, the Muslim world was a collection of cultures; they drew together and advanced the knowledge gained from the ancient Greek, Roman, Persian, Chinese, Indian, Egyptian, and Phoenician civilizations.
